thread.title: 2nd man charged in fatal drive-by pleads not guilty
thread.title_full: 2nd man charged in fatal drive-by pleads not guilty

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: 2nd man charged in fatal drive-by pleads not guilty
text:
A second man accused in the August drive-by shooting on Genesee Street pleaded not guilty to the charges Wednesday. Jalen Jamel Everett, 20, of 334 Selye Terrace, is charged with first-degree murder in connection with the Aug. 19 shooting in front of the Boys & Girls Club that left three -- Raekwon Manigault, Jonah Barley, and Johnny Johnson -- dead. Four others were wounded.
Everett, who is being held without bail, is accused of participating in the drive-by.
A preliminary in the case is scheduled for 10:30 a.m. Friday.
Johnny Blackshell Jr., 21, of Chili, has already been charged with first-degree murder in the case.
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Genesee St. shooting suspect charged with murder
Everett was arrested on Sept. 29 at the Buffalo Airport as he was attempting to leave the state, according to Rochester Police Chief Michael Ciminelli.
Everett, who has been in custody since then, was charged with fourth-degree criminal possession of stolen property relating to a laptop computer.
He was arrested in connection with the murders on Tuesday.
ROCHESTER DEMOCRAT AND CHRONICLE
Killer AK-47 traced to burglary
Ciminelli said the investigation is active and additional charges and arrests are possible.
